{"step_by_step_thinking": "MHC antigens are absent on erythrocytes. According to Document [13], H antigen, which is located on the 19th chromosome in humans, is a precursor to each of the ABO blood group antigens and is apparently present in all people except those with the Bombay Blood phenotype. Erythrocytes are known to express ABO blood group antigens but not MHC antigens. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Erythrocyte.", "answer_choice": "B"}
